revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=16:23, 3 December 2011 (UTC) |action1link=Talk:Japanese aircraft carrier Hiyō/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=463833326 ||action2=GTC |action2date=18:41, 5 February 2012 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Hiyō class aircraft carrier/archive1 |action2result=promoted |ftname=Hiyō class aircraft carrier |currentstatus=GA |topic=war }} {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Ships|class=GA}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=GA|Aviation=yes|Japanese-task-force=yes|Maritime-task-force=yes|WWII-task-force=yes}} {{WikiProject Japan|class=GA|importance=mid|milhist=y}} }} ==WP:MILHIST Assessment== If not for the infobox, this would be a Stub. Expansion needed. [[User:LordAmeth|LordAmeth]] 18:03, 19 October 2006 (UTC) :I have added the original aircraft complement from the start of the war. [[User:Shibumi2|Shibumi2]] 00:02, 11 January 2007 (UTC) I added a expansion thingy.[[User:R68 2818|R68 2818]] 21:18, 21 April 2007 (UTC) == Hiyo in Heroes of the Pacific == In one of the campaigns (Mariana Islands), a carrier by the name of Hiyo is the main target once you reach the Japanese fleet. == Sinking the USS Meredith == I was looking on Combinedfleet.com, and the record for ''Hiyo'' there makes no mention of the attack on ''Meredith''. However, the entry for ''Zuikaku'' and ''Shokaku'' says that those two ships were the ones that launched the airstrike that sank ''Meredith''. Someone want to verify this? —[[User:Masterblooregard|Masterblooregard]] ([[User talk:Masterblooregard|talk]]) 02:17, 29 May 2012 (UTC) == Sister ship Junyo == I was surprised that this article has no mention of the Junyo, her sister ship. This is particularly surprising given that the Junyo and Hiyo regularly served together. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/130.184.236.240|130.184.236.240]] ([[User talk:130.184.236.240|talk]]) 15:17, 19 February 2014 (UTC) :Read it again. There are at least two mentions in the service section.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 17:30, 19 February 2014 (UTC) == Hitaka == [[Edward L. Beach Jr.]] misidentifies this ship as the ''Hitaka'' in ''Submarine!'', and I've seen that name floating around elsewhere. Should that discrepancy be documented in the article? [[User:Mackensen|Mackensen]] [[User_talk:Mackensen|(talk)]] 23:40, 12 January 2016 (UTC) :I've never seen it myself. Feel free to address the issue yourself, just be sure to match citation style and English variation.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 00:22, 13 January 2016 (UTC)
